headline: Easy Parmesan-Crusted Chicken
description: Try this Parmesan-crusted chicken recipe for juicy, tender chicken breasts coated in a mixture of Parmesan cheese and seasoned bread crumbs.
name: Easy Parmesan-Crusted Chicken
recipeIngredient: 4 (5 ounce) boneless, skinless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix mayonnaise and Parmesan together in a medium bowl until well combined.
Arrange chicken on the prepared baking sheet. Spread mayonnaise mixture over top, then top with bread crumbs.

Cook in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I made it; it was DELICIOUS! My bf said it was like something that would come out of a restaurant

Je la fait plusieurs fois depuis des années et c'est toujours délicieux en plus elle est très facile à réalisée , j'ajoute des herbes italiennes dans mon mélange mayonnaise et fromage parmesan et mélange le tout !
Came out perfect! I used chicken breast strips and they were perfect. A new favorite recipe

Used this recipe with various adaptations. Always and I mean always mouth watering. I don’t have Parm but I do have either Feta or Blue cheese in the fridge but I don’t remember. Either one will be Devine. I always add a little heat just because I cap.
Turned out great!
We loved this recipe but I added Italian dressing to the Mayo and used corn flake crumbs to coat, it is now a family favorite!
Love this dish! And even my picky kids love it!
super easy and tasted great.

I made this recipe twice. So yummy. I did add 1/2 tsp smoked paprika and fresh chopped oregano, and a little more generous with the seasoned panko crumbs and garlic. I also loosely applied aluminum foil for the first half of cooking time to avoid splatters. This will become one of our regular go-to meals.

As written the recipe is pretty good. I didn't need all the mayo to coat the chicken. The breading can get a little soggy. Second time around I made some adjustments. Instead of combining everything, I thinly coated the chicken with mayo and then dredged it in the bread crumb mixture. For the mixture, I added a few seasonings to my taste, like pepper and garlic powder. When cooking, I put the breasts on a baking rack to keep from getting soggy. Made it 5 stars
This recipe is easy to follow and tastes great. I cut up the chicken and used this recipe to make homemade chicken nuggets. I've gotten rave reviews from everyone on them!
The recipe was quite simple to follow. I didn’t have seasoned bread crumbs, I used regular bread crumbs added Italian seasoning.But it was quite tasty.
Delicious!!! Just added a little salt and pepper to the chicken before hand m.

Made it and loved it! Definitely a keeper recipe. Dipped the chicken in the cheese and mayo mixture and breaded the chicken on both sides. Cooked it 5 extra minutes. The chicken was so soft and moist you could cut it with fork!

I was disappointed with this. The taste was okay, not as wonderful add other reviewers found. The chicken never browned until put under the broiler. It looked less anemic them. Will use less mayo next time and see if that helps make it crispier.
Chicken turned out nice and juicy ... easy recipe to make

I seasoned the chicken with oregano and onion powder, first. I cut the mayo/parm mixture in half and it was enough to cover both sides of 4 chicken breast and 4 chicken thighs. I cooked it uncovered for 35 minutes because the chicken breasts were thick.
Thicker chicken, a lot more time!

DO NOT SALT THE CHICKEN. It’s already a very salty dish. Take out at internal temp of 165° and don’t check it too often. Two breasts took me closer to 20-25 Going to the temp on the meat thermometer is for dark chicken. Otherwise a very good, if simple, dish. People who like more flavor may want to do more than just use a sprinkle of herbed breadcrumbs.
Easy and delicious!
Very good, recipe is a keeper. Served with steamed green beans and purple potatoes. it’s a quick and easy dinner too when you’re pressed for time.

I've made this many times and it always turns out amazing. the mayonnaise makes it juicy and tender, while the Parmesan cheese gives it a nice flavor and the breadcrumbs gives it a nice crunch.

make it, you won't regret it
This was amazing! so easy and very moist and tasty. family loved it! i did put it on a rack.
Absolutely delicious! The chicken was moist and juicy. My husband loves parm crusted chicken, so I surprised him with this. He raved! great, quick and easy recipe!
I used Miracle Whip instead of mayonnaise.
I thought it tasted like Mayonnaise and that is it. So if your not a huge fan of Mayo don't make this.
I want sure if my family would like this, but it was soo yummy! Definitely a keeper!
Took it easy on the mayo (used it as a rub) and pressed the parmesan mixture into the chicken. Very moist and tasty and couldn't be any easier.

I made this for dinner tonight and all went for a second helping!!! One thing I used as I found out I was out of breadcrumbs was Ritz crackers!!! Just crushed almost a tube of them and added seasoned salt. This is an extremely easy recipe and very very good!!! Will definitely make this AGAIN????????

I simply smeared the mayo on the chicken, then sprinkled with the breadcrumbs and parmesan. 

Add squeezed lemon to the chicken first.
I sub, 1/4 cup of butter 1/4 cup butter flavor crisco melted in place of mayo . also add shredded fresh parm , cheese on top . Excellent ! an Easy

This was good but not great. It does have potential. I cut the chicken breasts in half horizontally and reduced the amount of mayonnaise. To the mayonnaise, I added a bit of onion powder, garlic powder, and dried oregano and also used panko and spritzed the top with EVOO from my mister. Baked on a baking rack so the air would circulate underneath and not get soggy. I coated both sides of the chicken breast and turned it about half way through cooking time. I reduced the cooking time due to the thinness of the breast. I turned the chicken again and turned the oven from bake to broil for a couple minutes to crisp it up more. Sliced on the diagonal and served with spaghetti with homemade marinara sauce. I will make again but next time I think I will use even less mayonnaise and sear it quickly on both sides in the cast iron skillet before putting in the oven in the cast iron skillet.
So easy and delicious!
Easy and delicious!

I just made this tonight and the first words out my families mouth was “This is the juiciest chicken you’ve ever made!” When I asked if this was “a keeper” the consensus was “Definitely!”I did add a teaspoon of garlic powder but otherwise I made it exactly as written. Definitely on my list of easy dinners to make!!
This was so so so easy and tasty!!!! Thank you recipe Gods!
My husband does not eat chicken unless I make this recipe. definitly a quick meal to fix and generaly no left overs!
I made this chicken dish exactly as directed and it came out moist and crispy and delicious. So wonderfully easy, I'm sure I will make again often.
Topping wasn't the best; wouldn't spread across the chicken pieces properly.
My kids love this (and they are very picky eaters)! Easy and quick and a family hit. I use the light mayonnaise and it still tastes great!
I love this recipe. I omit the bread crumbs because I simple don’t like the texture. What I do is that I add badia complete seasoning to the mix of mayo and cheese. Absolutely delicious.

This recipe is SOOO easy & SUPER DELICIOUS! It is made with ingredients you'll already have in your kitchen, is quick to put together & everyone will love it! it's one of my family's favorites...you should definitely try it!
This was easy to make and oh so delicious. I am not a huge mayo fan so I think that next time I will try it with yogurt.

I made this with 1 HUGE Chicken breast using 4 tbsp. of mayo and 2 tbsp. of parmisan cheese and a little garlic powder. I coated both sides. It was delicious! Because the breast was so thick, I cooked it about 40 minutes at 425. I had no problem with it being greasy or wet.
As tasty as it was easy. Great weeknight meal.

This was so easy! I had just come home from a conference, arriving mid afternoon and was to have dinner guests that evening. This was the perfect dish. It was easy, I had the ingredients on hand, but it tasted like I'd put a lot of work into it. I did substitute part of the mayonnaise with light sour cream because I don't like a heavy mayonnaise taste. I probably could have put a lighter coat of the topping on as well. My guests and husband agreed. I need to make this again!

This dish was easy to make and delicious. The only reason I did not give it five stars was because it was a bit greasy. The next time I make it I will use half of the mayonnaise that is indicated in the recipe (1/4 cup instead of 1/2 cup). I suspect it will come out equally tasty but just a little healthier.

this recipe was absolutely awful.
the "breading" whatever doesn't stick to the chicken so it basically falls off and you have naked baked chicken. also... 20 minutes cooking time and the chicken was still raw.
sucks. don't bother. actually run
Very moist and yummy! A keeper to be sure! Used light mayo to cut a few calories. Thanks for a fast simple solution for a tasty dinner!
Easy & Good! My family loved it!

I cooked this one night after a long, hard day at work when I wanted easy to make and with very few ingredients. I was not disappointed. The chicken was crispy, yet moist,and the flavor was very tasty.

I absolutely love this recipe! I use plain bread crumbs and season them myself. I add grated parmesan to the breading mixture. I coat both sides of the chicken with the mayo mixture and bread crumbs. Be sure to dry off the chicken before spreading on the mayo - your chicken won't get soggy while it's cooking.
It was quick and easy, will add it to my list of favorites.

My husband was not really thrilled when I told him I wanted to try this recipe. I had told him I was going to make chicken parm with spaghetti which he was happy about. I gave it a shot despite his negative comments about using mayo as a base and boy am I glad I did! The chicken was moist and tasted great! It was so good my husband even said he was wrong... for once! I will definitely make this again! Thank you!

This recipe has great taste and was a rare winner with all four kids. I used Spice Islands crunchy panko seasoned coating mix for bread crumbs. It did take quite a bit longer to cook than 20 minutes. more like 45. Will definitely have this again.
This is quick, easy and delicious. It seems like a lot of mayo but once baked it's perfect.

Super moist and juicy! My two picky little eaters absolutely love it and it's so quick and easy to make! I did use 1/3 of a cup of Parmesan instead of half and next time I think I'll use an even ratio of cheese to mayonnaise just because we love cheese dip much! It definitely is delicious though!

It was OK, just not great. One dinner guest removed the crust completely and ate it, but he said he would not want to serve it himself. One guest loved it. I have to agree with the first. I love mayo, but it just doesn't work for me in this recipe.

The recipe says to cook for 20 minutes....we had to cook 40 min...was delicious...we made 2 different versions of chicken parmesan...this one with Hellman's mayo and another by dipping chicken breast in egg and Panko crumbs....this recipe was a hit....
Made this for dinner after work. It was easy and fast to make. Very delicious and juicy.
This was just so so. The chicken was moist enough, but the crust flavor was bland.
Loved this recipe! The capers add a wonderful addition to my regular bruschetta recipe.

Quick, easy and delicious! Perfect for a busy school night. Amazing how moist and tasty the chicken is. I used chicken breast and cut them into thin cut horizontal pieces. My children loved it! I have leftover mayonnaise and parmigiana mixture which I am going to prepare the same recipe using tilapia. Definitely will be making this again!
Sure easy and quite tasty. I would give the flavor a 4 star, but the easy of it earned it 5 overall.
So darn good! The recipe didn't need any changes. We will definitely be making this more often.
I followed the recipe. I didn't have mayo so I used an egg wash and it came out perfect. Next time will coat with Mayo. Still delicious!

I will make this easy, delicious main dish again. I had to substitute a couple of the ingredients (three cheese blend for the parm and panko for the Italian bread crumbs) because it's what I had on hand. Even the picky eaters in the crowd loved the dish. Plated with some steamed broccoli and corn on the cob made a very eye-appealing, speedy meal. I did have to increase the baking time due to the chicken pieces being thicker than normal.
this recipe is 100% accurate. Loved it.
I made it exactly as written. Delicious.
Followed the recipe as written, which was wonderful. Moist and tasty chicken makes this something I would make again.
This was the best crusted chicken I've made. I would definitely use this recipe again. I served it with spaghetti sauce and noodles with extra parmesan cheese on top.
Cook on a cooling rack over top of baking sheet, just make sure the rack is oven worthy (the grid style typically works). I mixed a cube of frozen garlic in with the mayo. Clean plates!

Really good! Very simple & easy to follow. I tweaked just a few things the second time around - instead of using Mayo, I soaked the chicken in egg and then covered it in a mixture of Parmesan and bread crumbs. Also really good as well. :)
delicious! i was worried about it not crisping up nicely. so i pan fried the chicken a minute a side before putting in the oven, yum ??

Actually I'm in the process of making it for the first time. I didn't have mayo so I used olive oil. I seasoned the chicken with salt and pepper to taste added powered garlic and Italian seasoning. Let it set for about thirty minutes so some of the flavors could soak in. I used 1/3 parmigiano cheese and 2/3 plain bread crumbs because I didn't have the other. It was a hit! I will definitely make this one again??

This turned out amazingly!!! I'm so excited to use it a lot more often! But i didn't have preseasoned bread crumbs so i toasted a few pieces of bread and put Italian seasoning garlic powder onion powder and dried cilantro in a bag and crunched it all together. Also this way you can control a little more what flavors are going into it but it turned out to be one of my now favorite chickens!
Pretty good! Made it with shredded mozzarella & sprinkled Parmesan & liked it. The mayo was a bit much, though. Thinking of substituting something...
Easy and very good!
I needed something quick with ingredients I had on hand . I didnt expect this to turn out so well. It was moist with a crisp crust.
A family favorite. I use less mayo then it calls for. and for the Italian breadcrumbs I mash up rice cereal and add Italian seasoning or just parsley. so simple and yet so good!
Amazing! I love this recipe...
Astounding! Simple and easy to follow! I cooked my chicken for 30 minutes and wow! Moist as could be! My family raved over it. You can add some extra spices to add more flavor, but simple!
Very easy and super good

Very tasty for being so simple.

We followed the directions pretty much to a T. We put a tiny bit less seasoning, but that was it.

I would recommend drying your chicken off with a paper towel before putting the mayo on it. I also dipped the chicken in the mayo and took enough off to leave a thin layer of it. Then I mixed Italian panco bread crumbs with the parmesan in a bowl. Alas, I put the mayo chicken in the panco/parm and covered it thoroughly. I baked it on a cookie sheet for about 35 minutes. I put the chicken on linguine noodles and sauced it with spaghetti sauce. The chicken was very moist and had no issue with crisp-ness. Great alone but the Bf loves chicken parmesan with noodles and sauce. Topping it all with mozzarella is a good choice too. I will make again!:)
I always add a little garlic salt to the mayonnaise mixture. Delicious!
Very good recipe! My dad is super picky and he really liked it!
I've made this for years. I coat the chicken lightly with olive oil instead of mayo. The just before done, I put under the broiler for about two minutes to get the chicken nice and brown.
wow! easy, quick, delicious and you can tweak it however you want with ease. very juicy and full of flavor. I have a few friends that are picky eaters and they loved this and asked for the recipe.
very simple! delicious, quick, and moist.
Such an easy recipe! It turned out delicious!
We make this about once a week. It's super easy and delicious. And nice breadcrumbs makes a nice crust and a great meal with green beans and rice. Or salad side.

it was really easy and delicious! I used very thin sliced chicken breasts and bake 15 minutes at 350. I used 1/4 cup of mayo instead of 1/2 cup and turn out great! Thank you for this great recipe !! I will do it again for sure!!
The only thing I did different was completely coat them with mayonnaise and bread crumb mixtures. This is a great recipe and simple to make.
This is so simple and both kids and adults love it in my house! I stick to the recipe and it is a hit every time!
This is absolutely hands down my favorite!! Especially with garlic and onion potatoes and mac & cheese!
Needs much longer than 20 mins
I loved how easy this was. And, it has ingredients I usually have on hand. Very tasty too.
It was simple to make and the kids liked it alot.
